title: Netflix Movies and TV Shows
text: This dataset contains information about movies and TV shows available on Netflix. I will create a simple visualization to see how much content Netflix has for movies versus TV shows.

title: Netflix Movies and TV Shows
text: This dataset contains information about movies and TV shows available on Netflix. I will create a simple visualization to see how much content Netflix has for movies versus TV shows.

title: Netflix Movies and TV Shows
text:
Data Loading
library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)
netflix <- readr::read_csv(‘https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2021/2021-04-20/netflix_titles.csv’) content_counts <- netflix |> count(type)
ggplot(content_counts, aes(x = type, y = n)) + geom_col(fill = “red”) + labs(title = “Netflix Content: Movies vs TV Shows”, x = “Content Type”, y = “Number of Titles”)

title: Coffee Ratings Analysis
text: This dataset has coffee ratings from around the world. I want to see which countries produce the highest rated coffee by looking at the total cupping scores.

title: Coffee Ratings Analysis
text: This dataset has coffee ratings from around the world. I want to see which countries produce the highest rated coffee by looking at the total cupping scores.

title: Coffee Ratings Analysis
text:
Data Loading
library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)
coffee <- readr::read_csv(‘https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/main/data/2020/2020-07-07/coffee_ratings.csv’) country_ratings <- coffee %>% filter(!is.na(total_cup_points)) %>% group_by(country_of_origin) %>% summarise(avg_rating = mean(total_cup_points), count = n()) %>% filter(count >= 5) %>% arrange(desc(avg_rating)) %>% head(10)
ggplot(country_ratings, aes(x = reorder(country_of_origin, avg_rating), y = avg_rating)) + geom_col(fill = “brown”) + coord_flip() + labs(title = “Top 10 Countries by Average Coffee Rating”, x = “Country”, y = “Average Rating”)

title: Eli Della Bitta
text: Hello, I am Eli Della Bitta. I am very interested in data science and using R to create models and quickly analyze data. Outside of the classroom, I love to play baseball, golf, pickleball, and go to the beach. Look around my website to learn more!
